comments.commentBody: There is no good public policy reason to give a public subsidy to people who undermine public willingness to pay tax.
It is perfectly stupid for governments to give subsidies and tax preferences to people who will use psychopathology to undermine public acceptance of taxation.

But the whole idea behind "free speech" is to be free of gov't harrassment.  If you're calling for the overthrow of the gov't or threatening violence, the president is constitutionally obligated to protect citizens/property from harm and you should draw attention from law enforcement.  It is the congress' responsibility to enforce tax collection; it is entirely their fault that the IRS is in trouble - congress not enforcing oversight and making numerous fuzzy rules that you can drive a truck thru.  No wonder we're trillions of dollars in debt.  No president can be blamed for budget deficits or credited with budget surpluses as long as we look the other way by giving legislators a pass.

If you come out in flurry of anti-govt rhetoric and talk about how you don't want to pay taxes, it's not a big surprise that the IRS starts keeping tabs on you.  If you rant publicly for drug legalization in a public setting maybe you might attract some attention.  Or maybe you might attend a labor protest, and the company you work for finds out that you attended, who knows, maybe you'll be first in line to get fired.  Wow, that would be a shocker.
It has never been a debate about textbook economics. More of a perpetual propaganda war. Goebbels would thrive in this environment.
Very simple and sweet! Let's vote this person in!
Vote, vote, vote, vote, vote, vote, vote, vote, vote, vote, vote. Isn't there a school board election or a water board election or a midterm election coming soon? Vote, vote, vote, vote.

Democrats swing the pendulum too far to the right! The Tea Party is validated in an odd way. But wait! The Occupy movement said this all along.

Minimum elements of solution:

Repeal the Patriot Act.

Fire Eric Holder.

Reject the "apology" of the IRS - fire whoever is in charge of it and the chain of command down to the supervisor (who isn't good at math) who ordered the "special scrutiny."

If there are no consequences now, all is dark.

I think you are missing the point big time. Certain groups are targeted by the government for voicing their concern about the government for 3 years, and the conclusion you draw from this is that the government isn't tyrannical? This wasn't a mistake, this actually was a conspiracy.

I know the shame of being "The One Who Let Her Daughter Dress That Way."   I was an insecure young single mom living in poverty .  Although I loved my daughter, I didn't always grasp the social norms that would make our family "respectable." For her kindergarten graduation, I bought her new clothes, but made the mistake of choosing a short set with a shirt that also happened to reveal her belly button. That day, I arrived with my daughter to discover that all the other little girl kindergartners were wearing beautiful, flowing long dresses. I felt  the sting of shame as I heard the whispers of  other parents who stared, horrified, at my daughter's belly button, as she proudly walked up to claim her diploma.  She was fortunately oblivious, but I realized my mistake too late.  After the ceremony, when most of the other moms shunned me as I tried to join them in their happy banter. I felt like I had utterly failed my daughter. Yet 15 years later she is a well adjusted college student, confident in her manner. Now I realize that the scandal of letting my daughter dress inappropriately was not so horrible  in the long run. My daughter is lovable - belly button, short shorts and all.  Ignore the judgmental goody goodies. Not everyone can see past the superficial to a person's true character.
They ARE thoroughly investigated. Did you see the list of "EXTRA" questions any "Tea Party" organization was asked to answer, including names of donors and volunteers?
I think Soros funds a few non-profits and he apparently asked for any additional information. Correct me if I'm wrong.

What was he lying about? There are several terrorist groups throughout the world. I took his statement to mean that  they weren't able to identify a specific group. I'm still,trying to figure out what the "scandal" is.

He did announce at the time that it was a terrorist attack, though Boehner doesn't understand the equivalence of the words "act of terror" and "terrorist attack". I do, and so do most people with brains.

Republicans are desperate. They got shellacked in the last election, and they're going to get worse in the next if they keep this up. The public is sick of hearing about who said what about Benghazi. The public gets that what's important is not what was said, but what was done as a result to make diplomatic posts safer.

What about motive for the purported Benghazi cover-up? Nixon lied to avoid criminal prosecution and to win re-election; Reagan lied to conceal illegal support for Nicaraguan rebels; Clinton lied for the same reason every unfaithful man lies; Bush lied about WMD's to justify an unnecessary war.

What did Obama stand to gain by characterizing the Benghazi attack as a spontaneous event triggered by the You Tube video, as opposed to correctly (apparently--are we sure we know?) describing it as an organized, deliberate terrorist assault?

Let's say Obama announced at the time that a terrorist attack had targeted our embassy in Benghazi. He may have been criticized for failing to provide adequate security, but that would have happened anyway (and has). But perhaps the country would have rallied around our commander in chief during a time of conflict and he would have had greater support in his re-election bid. It's easy to imagine Republicans complaining that Obama won re-election both due to superstorm Sandy and due to the terrorist attack in Benghazi, that he was again the benefactor of lucky wag-the-dog circumstances.

The motive for the alleged cover-up was to avoid a perception of security weakness, you say? But...we all know that the world is a dangerous place, especially post-Gaddafi Libya. I don't think Obama or any leader has guaranteed a world free from violence.

For all of you who are convinced of a premeditated, strategic cover-up: what would the motive be?

In the Aftermath of Benghazi, Hilary said she takes ultimate responsibility and Obama said the buck stops with him. I guess they wanted to appear magnanimous.

In my experience of 25 yrs in the Army, if I take responsibility, then I take the fall for the mistakes. So how is it that mid-level State Dept employees got fired but Hilary and Obama got off scot free?

Since Hilary said she takes full responsibility and Obama said the buck stops with him, then we should hold them to their words. Perhaps the "sideshow" started with them when they made empty political statements.
I would expect to hear of such tactics from Vladimir Putin's government,  not ours.    Guess anyone who thought this administration wouldn't play hardball is eating their words today.

This is why we must repeal the 2nd Amendment as soon as possible..
So we can finally eliminate those other inconvenient rights...
The whole point of this article is that the Justice Dept acted outside the law and their own guidelines.

I believe that your statements are conclusivory and that there are no facts that could hold up your accusations.

The greatest political break in our country is Wikileaks, without which there would have been a vacuum or void of information.

Frankly, I wish the type of information - the actual documents that Wikileaks acquired were available. Those were the days.

What disturbs me is that the WH was saying on Osama bin Laden's birthday that it had no information that there were any threats, while at the same time the CIA was working on a threat. (See bottom of story http://apnews.myway.com/article/20130513/DA68MMQ82.html So the press was calling out the government, it sounds like, not just selling a story.

It's about time that there was some control exerted over what information the news media makes public. In case you doofuses out there do not recall, there where a number of incidents during the iraqi war when the media in their lust for selling news described what was unfolding and our soldiers were ambushed and killed as a result.  Here you have someone in the CIA who has infiltrated Al Qaeda, they do not know about it, but then for the sake of selling copy our news media lets everyone in the world know that they have been compromised.   I wonder what you all would have said if the news release had led to the discovery of the infiltrator and as a result the planned bombing would have killed hundreds of innocent people.

Allow me to correct your typo: "separates" -> "separated".

There are still countries which respect the freedom of the press, but the USA is no longer one of them.

This is absolutely shocking. Even if the White House wasn't directly involved, it nevertheless is indirectly implicated because of AG Eric Holder. This should chill Americans, whether conservative or progressive, who value the freedoms on which this country was built and what separates it from much of the rest of the world.  It's also seriously undermined the country's moral and ethical platform that it uses to both set an example and to judge others. This is terrifying in its scope and implication.
One f the best movies I've ever seen. Chilling. Should be seen by all.

I am reminded of the time I watched the German movie: Das Leben der Anderen (The Lives of Others).

Apparently life is now imitating art, or, if you will, history.

Yes WNTfan, it is only now 6:36 AM on the 14th thanks to you that I first went back and read the quote carefully and then saw Yael's team logo to the left of the quote. One of the best things about the decade from age 70 to 80 and now 81 is that I have been able to live a life based on Sonia Sotomayor's wisdom.

Larry Lundgren Only-NeverInSweden.blogspot.com
Great opening quote.

Isn't ripping off millions of middle-class families of their homes, life savings and as mentioned above, municipal pensions and retirement funds an attack on AMERICA? Doesn't this weaken America? So why hasn't the DOJ used their authority tto seize phone and electronic communications of suspected financial wizards for destroying America's strength?

ALL can see the real harm, pain and suffering these money advsors and investors levied on America.
I agree completely.

I kind of got a feeling that something is already cooking. Tim has one of the best agents in the business. Jimmy Sexton. You can be sure that he is not just sitting around doing nothing. Something is boiling. It is just that Tim and Jim are smart enough to know to keep it under wraps until the deal is signed, sealed and delivered.

Excellent piece, Ms. Matus! I think that your reaction is pretty much the norm-- it is very difficult to react, to move or to scream in a packed subway car. And what you term being 'secretly skittish' is what I expect most women feel in dark, empty streets. Please don't feel ashamed for reacting as most women would.

It is wonderful that the NYC transit police were present and made an arrest in your case. You showed courage in cooperating with the police, in prosecuting your case and in writing about it for the New York Times. Kudos!

Tim can throw the ball plenty good enough. Vinny Testaverde said the following about Tim's throwing and he has no reason to lie. Testaverde said. "Everybody has been focusing on his throwing motion, trying to fix that, but nobody had picked up his footwork. His footwork was all screwed up. Chris and I looked at each other after about four or five throws, and we saw the same thing. We got his footwork fixed. His throwing motion is now a non-issue.
Excellent Review
Hi Judy - a question: so what if Sanchez "outplays everybody in camp"? That's just camp and we've already seen how he does in real games the past two years. Trade him away, please.

Chuck:

" That and some standard-issue radiation heat transfer show that anthropogenic, long-lived greenhouse gases have added some 14x10^21 Joules of energy to the climate system since 1950. This is some 7 times the amount of energy needed to explain the observed warming over that time period. (eg Murphy 2009)."

Why has there not been warming at the 7x rate? Exactly how flexible is this hypothesis you operate under?
